meaningMnemonic: You know that the kanji 当 means <kanji>right</kanji> or <kanji>success</kanji>. So since this is a verb, you're doing right and success (which doesn't make much sense). Instead, you're guessing something and getting it right. So, this word means <vocabulary>to guess</vocabulary> something. Hopefully you don't have to guess too hard when it comes to the meaning of this word as well.
readingMnemonic: The reading can be remembered via the word 当たる which you learned a few levels ago. Use that knowledge to remember that this word is read as あてる. The important part is the あ.
